result.execSummary:
The defendant Rondell Vermont Black was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. The defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program AFTER SERVING 2 1/2 YEARS OF THIS SENTENCE
Consecutive to: Any other time being served

superMiscConds.notes: $1950.00 payable to Tri City National Bank to be paid first. State in compliance with victim rights legislation.

Provide DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay mandatory surcharge, fees, assessments, surcharges and all other mandatory costs. The court ordered that all financial obligations and restitution to be paid through collection of sums by the DOC's from 25% funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
- Pay all supervision fees.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statues Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following: restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

- Obtain Mental Health Assessment - successfully complete follow-up treatment - take prescribed meds in the manner as prescribed by a treating physician only.
- Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment.
- Absolute sobriety (no alcohol/no illegal drugs) with random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- No drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers or drug houses).
- Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation Agent.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No contact with any Tri City National Bank.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment.
- Participate in Cognitive Thinking program.
- Obtain GED or HSED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rondell Vermont Black

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Decision And Order Denying Second Motion To Vacate The DNA Surcharge - signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to parties.
Clerk:  jms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se motion to vacate the DNA surcharge.
Signed and filed:  Decision and Order Denying Motion to Vacate DNA Surcharge.

Defendant's pro se motion to vacate DNA surcharge.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing JUNE 6, 2014 received and filed. (31 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION.
Defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Rondell Vermont Black in court with Attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Rondell Vermont Black in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  State's motion for presentence investigation report granted by the Court.  Defense allowed to be present for PSI interview if available.  Agent to attempt to contact defense counsel once; agent may proceed without counsel if contact is not made/return contact untimely. Defendant REMANDED INTO CUSTODY.   Jury trial set for 4-07-14 at 9:00 a.m. vacated at this time.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement and Order for PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Rondell Vermont Black not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Final pretrial held between counsel.  Defense requests date for possible plea prior to jury trial date.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel Calvin Malone appeared.  Defendant Rondell Vermony Black in custody and not produced for today's hearing.  State appeared by Megan Carmody.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney Malone is in trial in another court.    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 21 on 3-25-2014 at 1:30 pm.

Attorney Calvin R Malone in court, defendant Rondell Vermont Black not in court, in custody.  Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defense in contest posture and requests that the matter be set for jury trial.  Parties advised that any and all motions must be filed on or before the final pretrial date IN BRANCH 21; hearing date set at the time of filing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Rondell Vermont Black in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Rondell Vermont Black in custody.  Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Detective Madrina Dela-Cruz.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-10-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Rondell Vermont Black in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Rondell Vermont Black in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  PRELIMINARY HEARING SCHEDULED AT DA'S REQUEST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
